questions.question_text_1: What kind of functional genomics approach would you choose if you are interested in the study of how histone methylation regulates gene expression?
question_texts: What kind of functional genomics approach would you choose if you are interested in the study of how histone methylation regulates gene expression?

options.option_text: RNA-Seq
Transcriptomics
Epigenomics
Metabolomics

questions.question_text_1: Which one of the following is untrue about DNA sequencing methods?
question_texts: Which one of the following is untrue about DNA sequencing methods?

options.option_text: Purified fragments of DNA cut from plasmid/phage clones or amplified bypolymerase chain reaction (PCR)
Clones of DNA fragments are denatured to single strands, and one of thestrands is hybridized to an oligonucleotide primer
Reverse transcriptase is used to create DNA fragments during DNAsequencing
New strands of DNA are synthesized from the end of the primer

questions.question_text_1: A major design consideration in a microarray experiment is the incorporation of replicates. Which one of the following statements is most appropriate in stating the consequence(s) of not including replicates in your experiment?
question_texts: A major design consideration in a microarray experiment is the incorporation of replicates. Which one of the following statements is most appropriate in stating the consequence(s) of not including replicates in your experiment?

options.option_text: The number of false-positive errors in detecting differentially expressed geneswill increase
The number of false-negative errors in detecting differentially expressedgenes will increase
No statistical analysis of the significance of the observed changes will bepossible
All of these

questions.question_text_1: Imagine you are designing an experiment to measure gene expression in the blood of patients who have been treated with a new drug. You want to measure expression of all genes in the genome and may want to use the data to identify novel transcripts (e.g. miRNAs) in the future. Which method would you choose?
question_texts: Imagine you are designing an experiment to measure gene expression in the blood of patients who have been treated with a new drug. You want to measure expression of all genes in the genome and may want to use the data to identify novel transcripts (e.g. miRNAs) in the future. Which method would you choose?

options.option_text: Real-time PCR
ChiP-seq
Microarray analysis
RNA-seq

questions.question_text_1: In a RNA-seq experiment, which file contains raw sequence data?
question_texts: In a RNA-seq experiment, which file contains raw sequence data?

options.option_text: SAM file
BAM file
FASTQ file
CRAM file

questions.question_text_1: Which one of the following is most appropriate option?
question_texts: Which one of the following is most appropriate option?

options.option_text: Frameshift mutation involves the insertion or deletion of a single base in aDNA molecule
Mutagen is a substance or energy form that can cause a mutation in DNA
Point Mutation involves substitution of a single nucleotide in a DNA molecule

Frameshift mutation involves the insertion or deletion of a single base in aDNA molecule, Mutagen is a substance or energy form that can cause a mutation in DNA andPoint Mutation involves substitution of a single nucleotide in a DNA molecule
None of these

questions.question_text_1: In a DNA molecule, which molecules make up the backbone of the double helix?
question_texts: In a DNA molecule, which molecules make up the backbone of the double helix?

options.option_text: Single nucleotides
Joined sugar and phosphates
Joined nitrogenous base and phosphates
Paired nucleotides

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following accounts for the inability of dideoxynucleotide triphosphates (ddNTPs) to further polymerize in Sanger DNA sequencing?
question_texts: Which of the following accounts for the inability of dideoxynucleotide triphosphates (ddNTPs) to further polymerize in Sanger DNA sequencing?

options.option_text: Lack of a hydroxyl group on the 2' carbon
Lack of a hydroxyl group on the 3' carbon
Lack of a triphosphate moiety on the 5' carbon
Presence of a hydroxyl group on the 3' carbon

questions.question_text_1: A connected graph is said to have an Eulerian path if it has zero or two vertices with odd degrees. Given the degree distribution of the two connected graphs, Graph-A and Graph-B, find if any of the graphs has the Eulerian path.
questions.question_text_2: A connected graph is said to have an Eulerian path if it has zero or two vertices with odd degrees. Given the degree distribution of the two connected graphs, Graph-A and Graph-B, find if any of the graphs has the Eulerian path.
question_texts: A connected graph is said to have an Eulerian path if it has zero or two vertices with odd degrees. Given the degree distribution of the two connected graphs, Graph-A and Graph-B, find if any of the graphs has the Eulerian path.

A connected graph is said to have an Eulerian path if it has zero or two vertices with odd degrees. Given the degree distribution of the two connected graphs, Graph-A and Graph-B, find if any of the graphs has the Eulerian path.

options.option_text: Only Graph A
Only Graph B
Both Graph A and Graph B
Neither of them

questions.question_text_1: What value of p for an Erdos-Renyi network G(n,p), would generate a random network comparable to a regular lattice with n=25 and k=3?

questions.question_text_1: Let ‘A’ denote the adjacency matrix of a graph, and ‘n’ denote the number of non-zero elements in ‘A’. Which one of the following is true?
question_texts: Let ‘A’ denote the adjacency matrix of a graph, and ‘n’ denote the number of non-zero elements in ‘A’. Which one of the following is true?

options.option_text: If A represents an undirected graph, then n is always an even number
If A represents a directed graph, then n is always an even number
If self-loops are allowed, then n is always an even number
In a weighted graph, the sum of all the elements in A equals n

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are true about the regular graph?
question_texts: Which of the following are true about the regular graph?

options.option_text: It is a connected graph
The degree distribution of the graph follows the binomial distribution
The clustering coefficient is the same for all the nodes
The number of neighbours for all the nodes remains the same

questions.question_text_1: Through proteomics studies, which of the following research-questions can be addressed. Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Through proteomics studies, which of the following research-questions can be addressed. Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: Is the abundance of the tumour suppressor p-53 affected by growth of ahuman cell line in the presence of penicillin?
Which genes are upregulated in response to lower temperatures in a cultureof S. cerevisiae?
Which proteins are localised to the Golgi apparatus in mouse liverhepatocytes?
Which SNPs are associated with Breast Cancer?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are the application of metabolomics. Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are the application of metabolomics. Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: Identification of disease biomarkers
Mass production of essential proteins and metabolites
Determination of SNPs associated with a disease
To study gene-expression pattern in a context-specific manner

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are true for Illumina sequencing? Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are true for Illumina sequencing? Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: Sequence a single DNA fragment at a time
Short fragment reads (100-150 bp) are ligated to the flow cell surface
Ability to sequence hundreds to thousands of genes or gene regionssimultaneously
None of these

questions.question_text_1: Let ‘A’ be the adjacency matrix of a fully connected bi-partite graph with seven nodes. Five nodes belong to one group, and the other two belong to the other. The matrix ‘A’ has rows and columns arranged so that the first five rows (and columns) denote the nodes from one particular group. Let n be the number of non-zero elements in the graph. Which of the following are true? Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Let ‘A’ be the adjacency matrix of a fully connected bi-partite graph with seven nodes. Five nodes belong to one group, and the other two belong to the other. The matrix ‘A’ has rows and columns arranged so that the first five rows (and columns) denote the nodes from one particular group. Let n be the number of non-zero elements in the graph. Which of the following are true? Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: The maximum value of n is 20
n is always an even number
The number of non-zero elements in A[:5 , :5] is 10
The minimum value of n is 10

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are not an example of a biological network? Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are not an example of a biological network? Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: Metabolic network
Citation network from a biological journal
Signaling network
People from a Facebook group “Big data in biology”

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are true statements. Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are true statements. Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: Number of parameters required for generating a Erdos-Renyi graph is 2
Number of parameters required for generating a Watts-Strogatz graph is 3
Number of parameters required for generating a power-law graph is 1
Neither of them are correct

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are true about the Watts-Strogatz network? Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are true about the Watts-Strogatz network? Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: It can capture the degree distribution of the real-world network
It can capture the small-world properties of the real-world network
It has a long-tail degree distribution
It can capture the characteristic path length of the real-world network

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are true for RNA-seq studies? Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are true for RNA-seq studies? Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: Bulk RNA-seq captures only an “average” of the expression profiles ofthousands of cells
Single cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) allows the capture of individual measurementsacross dozens and up to thousands of single cells
RNA transcripts generated are identical across all the cell-types.
Post-translational modifications can be studied using RNA-seq approach.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are correct for Multi-omics studies? Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are correct for Multi-omics studies? Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: It combines genomic data with data from other modalities such astranscriptomics, epigenetics, and proteomics
It enables a more comprehensive understanding of molecular changescontributing to normal development, cellular response, and disease
It focuses on one aspect of the biological system
It allows the systematic understanding of information flow across differentomics layers

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are true about GWAS studies? Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are true about GWAS studies? Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: GWAS test hundreds of thousands of genetic variants across many genomes tofind those statistically associated with a specific trait or disease
GWAS can be used to predict an individual’s risk for physical and mentaldisease based on their genetic profile
If a variant is found to be associated with a trait, it means that a variant in thatgenomic region may cause a difference in the trait
If a variant is found to be associated with a trait, it means that a variant in thatgenomic region certainly causes a difference in the trait

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are true statements. Select all the correct options.
question_texts: Which of the following are true statements. Select all the correct options.

options.option_text: Nanopore is long read sequencing technique, whereas, Illumina sequencing isshort read sequencing technique.
Nanopore has 99% accuracy whereas Illumina has 92-95% accuracy
Nanopore sequencing technology uses change in current in protein nanoporewhen DNA is passed through it
Illumina sequencing uses reversible dye terminator technology to detect thesequence of DNA molecules
